required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Glucagon Administered in Different Forms and Routes to Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Site, Randomized, Four-Way, Four-Period PK/PD Crossover Phase 1 Clinical Study in 16 Fasted Healthy Adult Volunteers Receiving 3 Dose Levels of Intranasally Administered Glucagon and One Dose Level of Glucagon Administered by Subcutaneous Injection

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study was to evaluate the safety and tolerability of nasal glucagon (NG). The study drug was delivered into the participant's nostril (intranasally) or was given as an injection just under the skin (subcutaneously) once in each of four study periods. The study lasted about 23 days for each participant.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability evaluated through the assessment of adverse events. A SAE (serious adverse event) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation, which did not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. A summary of other non-serious AEs, and all SAE's, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to T (AUC[0-tlast]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
PK: Area Under the Curve Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC[0-inf]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
PK: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
PK: Maximum Change From Baseline Concentration (Cmax) of Glucagon
Pharmacodynamics (PD): Area Under the Effect Concentration Time Curve (AUEC₀₋₄) of Glucose
PD: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Baseline-Adjusted Glucose

arm_group.description: Ng dose at 0.5 milligram (mg) administered once in one of four study periods.
Ng dose at 1.0 milligram (mg) administered once in one of four study periods.
Ng dose at 2.0 milligram (mg) administered once in one of four study periods.
Subcutaneous (SC) glucagon dose of 1 mg, in one of four study periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 20.00 and below or equal to 28.00 kg/m².
- Light-, non- or ex-smokers.
- Have no clinically significant diseases captured in the medical history or evidence of clinically significant findings on physical examination and/or clinical laboratory evaluations (hematology, biochemistry, ECG and urinalysis).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any nose piercings.
- History of significant hypersensitivity to glucagon or any related products (including excipients of the formulations) as well as severe hypersensitivity reactions (like angioedema) to any drugs.
- Presence of significant gastrointestinal, liver or kidney disease, or any other conditions known to interfere with the absorption, distribution, metabolism or excretion of drugs or known to potentiate or predispose to undesired effects.
- Presence of significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, hematologic, neurological, psychiatric, endocrine, immunologic or dermatologic disease.
- Presence of clinically significant findings on nasal examination and bilateral anterior rhinoscopy.
- Fasting blood glucose above 5.0 millimoles per liter (mmol/L) at screening, following a 12-hour fasting period.
- Fasting blood glucose assessed with a glucose meter above 5.5 mmol/L 0.5 hour before each dosing.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a four-period crossover study in which participants received a single dose of study drug in each period, with seven days between each dose.

group.title: Sequence 1 (T1/T2/T3/T4)
group.description: Treatment (T1) = nasal glucagon (NG) dose of 0.5 milligram (mg), T2 = NG dose of 1 mg, T3 = NG dose of 2 mg, T4 = subcutaneous (SC) glucagon dose of 1 mg. In each of four study periods, a single dose of NG was administered or SC glucagon was administered.

group.title: Sequence 2 (T2/T3/T4/T1)
group.description: T2 = NG dose of 1 mg, T3 = NG dose of 2 mg, T4 = SC glucagon dose of 1 mg, T1 = NG dose of 0.5 mg. In each of four study periods, a single dose of NG was administered or SC glucagon was administered.

group.title: Sequence 3 (T3/T4/T1/T2)
group.description: T3 = NG dose of 2 mg, T4 = SC glucagon dose of 1 mg, T1 = NG dose of 0.5 mg, T2 = NG dose of 1 mg. In each of four study periods, a single dose of NG was administered or SC glucagon was administered.

group.title: Sequence 4 (T4/T1/T2/T3)
group.description: T4 = SC glucagon dose of 1 mg, T1 = NG dose of 0.5 mg, T2 = NG dose of 1 mg, T3 = NG dose of 2 mg. In each of four study periods, a single dose of NG was administered or SC glucagon was administered.

participants_list.participants: One participant completed study period two, but did not enter study period three.
One participant completed study period three, but did not enter study period four.
One participant completed study period three, but did not enter study period four.

baseline.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: In each of four study periods, a single dose of either NG or SC glucagon was administered.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs)
outcome.description: Safety and tolerability evaluated through the assessment of adverse events. A SAE (serious adverse event) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation, which did not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. A summary of other non-serious AEs, and all SAE's, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who entered study period four.

measure.title: Number of Participants With One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs)
measure.description: Safety and tolerability evaluated through the assessment of adverse events. A SAE (serious adverse event) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation, which did not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. A summary of other non-serious AEs, and all SAE's, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.
measure.population: All randomized participants who entered study period four.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to T (AUC[0-tlast]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
outcome.population: All randomized participants with evaluable PK data. In the NG 0.5 mg arm, all participants had serum glucagon levels that were below the lower limit of quantification (100 picogram per milliliter [pg/mL]) except for one participant at one time point.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to T (AUC[0-tlast]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
measure.population: All randomized participants with evaluable PK data. In the NG 0.5 mg arm, all participants had serum glucagon levels that were below the lower limit of quantification (100 picogram per milliliter [pg/mL]) except for one participant at one time point.

outcome.title: PK: Area Under the Curve Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC[0-inf]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
outcome.population: All randomized participants with evaluable PK data. AUC(0-inf) could not be calculated for the NG 0.5 mg arm, because all participants had serum glucagon levels below the lower limit of quantification (100 pg/mL) except for one participant at one time point.

reported_events.time_frame: First dose of study drug (Day 1) until post-study completion (Day 23)
reported_events.desc: All randomized participants who entered study period four.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
